metadata.story_name:
Not one of the five planets that orbit the yellow star Pelagea is fit for sentient life, but that hasn't stopped this remote system from becoming a hive of activity.  The planets and asteroid fields are prime sites for gas and mineral mining—and, even better, the place is so remote that the near-ubiquitous Company has only a token presence.

That might change one day, but for now, the system is free from their interference.  Free from protection, too, but those who would mind that don't come here.

Even without the Company, most people in Pelagius are engaged in legitimate work, whether that's mining, trade runs, or scientific research.  Some skirt the line between legal and... not-so-legal, turning to salvage, bounty hunting and the odd smuggling run.  But that's all mostly harmless, and it's not as if you ever fire the first shot.

And then there are the others: pirates and brigands who ply their nefarious trade from fortified "rogue stations".  People like the black-hearted crew of the _Shadow Chancellor_, a ship that everyone in the Pelagius System has learned to fear.

The best you can do is stay out of their way.  But that may be easier said than done.

writing_prompt: In the bustling chaos of Trade Station Heraklion, a shadowy fixer offers you a salvage job in the Rivera Belt—simple on the surface, but nothing in this system ever stays that way for long. What secrets might the scattered cargo hold, and who else might be after it?

metadata.story_name:
A thousand years ago, there was magic and technology beyond anything in the world today. People lived in great cities, worshipped strange gods, and performed miracles as easily as breathing. Most wondrous of all was Val’Raz, the Floating City, held aloft by spells now lost to time—until disaster or affronted gods cast it down to earth.

Or so the tales claim. Most serious scholars doubt that Val’Raz ever existed, though it is true that the ancients possessed magic unknown to any still living.

Then, an expedition sent by the renowned University of Shalben into the jungles of Tahella found a ruined city scattered across the landscape.  Rumour claimed it was the great Val'Raz, and though learned minds doubted, many still wanted to see.

As the excavation of the ruins progressed, guards and scholars began to go missing. No one knew what to make of it, not until a survivor limped back to camp.

He spoke one word and then collapsed. “Demons!”

writing_prompt: When an ancient archaeological dig uncovers whispers of demons and a bloodied mercenary stumbles into camp with dire warnings, the expedition leaders call for volunteers to investigate the mysterious Eastern Excavation—will you step forward?
